channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: New street light shining blinding light all through house, 28th November
item.description:
A new street light was repaired out the back of our garden yesterday and is producing a blinding light 24 hours a day. We have lived at 5 Brenchley Gardens since March 2025 with no issue. Since this was installed yesterday it is blinding residents with a constant dazzling spotlight that can't be escaped anywhere downstairs, preventing a toddler and dog from sleeping, creating constant light pollution. It is an unacceptable amount of light to be beaming into our house. Not livable. Needs to be dimmed significantly, preferably removed. At very least it must stop shining into our house and preferably garden. Attached photos were taken at 10pm with all house lights switched off. Totally unacceptable, needs urgent sorting!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-15, Brenchley Gardens, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped furniture on the stairs opposite Gatling Road, 28th November
item.description:
Resident moving out of area and has decided to dump their belongings on the stairs. It’s attracting unsociable behaviour. Please can this be collected ASAP.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gatling Road, Abbey Wood

item.title: Household Furniture dumped, 28th November
item.description:
This has been here for over a week now. Furniture left on the main road. It’s become an obstacle for local residents with mobility scooters and bikes.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gatling Road, Abbey Wood

item.title: Enfield council discrimination, 28th November
item.description:
It has been months not weeks since hoppers road, clutch hill, Downes court and green lanes and station road around the broadway pub have been cleaned at all. Bins are not emptied unless they Conservative councillors ask for them to be and my own bins are deliberately now not emptied. N21 have been cleaned at all. I have mitigated my journeys to remain on three roads so I do not see the uncleared filthy on all the other roads. It is targeted behaviour and incredibly frightening as a decision has been made to never clean particular roads, whilst Southgate high street has road cleaners en masse our cleaning every day. In Winchmore Hill we pay council tax, yet are we being targeted for a lessser service, in fact none at all. Concerningly, a senior council member has directly ordered non cleans for Winchmore Hill. Church hill remains a fully ignored road. The published rota is a lie. There is no street cleaning every Wednesday at church hill N21, there is none at all. I will be petitioning all of the residents of church hill over Christmas and focusing on this and the orchard the council have allowed to fe illegally felled without prosecution - much like the Whitewebbs tree. This discrimination is actually a legal offence. The chief executive is fully aware of these actions and complicit. I have nearly collated two months of neighbours ring camera footage on this road, showing no street ckeaner at all.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Church Hill, Southgate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 28th November
item.description:
Disgusting to see the amount of fly tipping happening in this one corner, this can attract rats and other animals. It is a very unpleasant site, can this please be dealt with!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stuart Road, Nunhead, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Fly Tipping by a frequent white van, 28th November
item.description:
White van has approached again and unloaded a full vehicle worth of furniture and dumped them by the bins. This is not the 1st time, more like the 10th but council won't let us report them. Next to communal bins behind co-op.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eynsham Drive, Abbey Wood

item.title: Tree sapping got run over, 28th November
item.description:
I saw one of the small tree saplings with the metal wire around it for it to grow knocked over with the tree fully laying down. Luckily it was small enough for me to get it up right but I feel like a bit of wind would knock it down. If it’s still standing it’s metal structure is all mangled and I’m guessing the tree needs to re replanted or something.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastern Way, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wellington Gardens needs sweeping, 27th November
item.description:
Wellington Gardens needs swiping, plastic bottles and litter on the pathway. Also there's a foul odour in proximity of n 40 which is clearly noticeable from the street, especially during last summer (possibly sewage?). It's unclear where it comes from. Thanks
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wellington Gardens, Charlton

item.title: Smashed glass been on floor here for weeks, 27th November
item.description:
There has been broken glass on this part of the cycle lane for weeks now (where the cycle lane merges onto Willowbrook Bridge. Please could it be cleared, and some sort of deterrent put in place to stop people making a dangerous mess on this canal path again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Nutt Street, Peckham, Greater London

item.title: A loose manhole cover on Greenwich High Road at the junction with Royal Hill, 27th November
item.description:
This loose manhole cover makes a loud clicking noise each time a vehicle drives over it. It has been very disturbing especially late at night and during the night. It has been going on for weeks now.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenwich High Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Oven and Box with Hobs Left on Street (again), 27th November
item.description:
Someone keeps dumping household items on the street. They always appear outside #4 worlingham road. This week, it is a full oven, and a box for some hobs (which appears to be full of tiles). Please can someone remove these itemts ASAP, and send some sort of enforcement letter to the house outside which the fly tipping seems to be happening.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Worlingham Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
